episodeTitle: Bounty! Straw Hat Luffy Becomes Known to the World!
episodeTitleJapanese: 賞金首！麦わらのルフィ世に知れ渡る
episodeTitleRomanized: Shōkinkubi! Mugiwara no Rufi yo ni shirewataru
description: Luffy receives his first bounty poster of 30 million berries, the highest bounty in the East Blue. News of this achievement spreads across the world, reaching allies like Shanks and former enemies like Buggy, Alvida, and Don Krieg. The Straw Hat crew celebrates but realizes the danger ahead as they set sail for Loguetown, the legendary town where Gold Roger was born and executed.

events.title: Luffy's First Bounty Revealed
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, Lieutenant Commander Brannew announces that Monkey D. Luffy has received his first bounty of 30 million berries, making it the highest bounty in the East Blue. The Marines recognize that every major East Blue pirate with a high bounty has been defeated by Luffy.
events.significance: This marks Luffy's official recognition by the World Government as a significant threat and establishes him as the most notorious pirate in the East Blue. It's a major milestone in his journey to become Pirate King.

quotes.text: Every pirate with a high bounty in East Blue has been defeated by Monkey D. Luffy.
quotes.speaker: Lieutenant Commander Brannew
quotes.context: Explaining why Luffy received such a high first bounty

events.title: News Coo Delivers Bounty Poster
events.description: A News Coo arrives at the Going Merry and delivers a newspaper containing Luffy's wanted poster. The crew discovers that Luffy now has a bounty on his head.
events.significance: The arrival of the News Coo represents the crew's first direct contact with the broader world's communication system and their new status as wanted criminals.

events.title: Luffy's Pride in His Bounty Poster
events.description: Luffy is overjoyed and proud of his first wanted poster, celebrating his 30 million berry bounty. He sees it as proof that he's making progress toward his dream of becoming Pirate King.
events.significance: This moment showcases Luffy's character - rather than being afraid of the danger, he's proud and excited about the recognition. It reinforces his unwavering optimism and determination.

quotes.text: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Nami's Concern About the Bounty
events.description: Nami expresses fear that the bounty makes them targets for bounty hunters and other pirates who will try to kill them for the reward money. She worries about the increased danger to the crew.
events.significance: Nami's reaction provides a realistic counterbalance to Luffy's enthusiasm, highlighting the practical dangers of being wanted criminals.

quotes.text: Everybody will try to kill us!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Usopp's Pride in the Bounty Poster
events.description: Usopp takes pride in Luffy's bounty poster, noting that the back of his head is visible in the photo, making him feel like he's also part of Luffy's accomplishment.
events.significance: This humorous moment shows Usopp's desire for recognition and his pride in being part of Luffy's crew, even in a small way.

events.title: Shanks Celebrates Luffy's Bounty
events.description: Dracule Mihawk visits Shanks and delivers news of Luffy's first bounty poster. Shanks is delighted to learn about Luffy's progress and throws a party to celebrate, reminiscing about the young boy from the village who wanted to become a pirate.
events.significance: This scene shows that Shanks has been waiting for news of Luffy and is proud of his progress. It reinforces their deep connection and Shanks' role as Luffy's mentor figure.

quotes.text: I remember a story you told me once about a kid in a little village.
quotes.speaker: Mihawk
quotes.context: Bringing news of Luffy's bounty to Shanks

events.title: Foosha Village Celebrates
events.description: The villagers of Foosha Village, Luffy's hometown, celebrate when they learn about his bounty. While Mayor Woop Slap is not entirely happy, calling it destiny rather than an achievement, the other villagers are proud and excited that Luffy is becoming a great pirate.
events.significance: This scene shows how Luffy's journey affects those back home and demonstrates the villagers' affection for him despite his criminal status.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo's Reaction
events.description: Koby and Helmeppo, now training as Marines, learn about Luffy's bounty. Koby reflects on his friend's rapid rise to infamy.
events.significance: This moment highlights the diverging paths of Luffy and Koby - one becoming a notorious pirate while the other trains to become a Marine. Despite being on opposite sides, Koby still sees Luffy as a friend.

events.title: Buggy and Alvida Form Alliance
events.description: Buggy and Alvida meet in a bar and discover they both have a grudge against Luffy after seeing his bounty poster. Realizing their shared enemy, they decide to join forces to take down Luffy.
events.significance: This marks the formation of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance, which will pursue Luffy into the Grand Line. It's the first time former enemies have teamed up specifically to target Luffy.

quotes.text: We both have a grudge against Straw Hat Luffy. Let's join forces!
quotes.speaker: Buggy

events.title: Don Krieg's Reaction
events.description: Don Krieg, recovering from his defeat at Baratie, learns about Luffy's bounty and is shown to be bitter about the young pirate who defeated him.
events.significance: This shows that Luffy's actions have lasting consequences for the pirates he's defeated, and establishes Don Krieg's continued resentment.

events.title: Decision to Visit Loguetown
events.description: The Straw Hat crew decides to stop at Loguetown before entering the Grand Line. Luffy is particularly excited to visit the town where Gold Roger, the Pirate King, was born and executed.
events.significance: This decision sets up the Loguetown Arc and represents the crew's final stop in the East Blue before entering the Grand Line. It shows Luffy's desire to connect with the legacy of the previous Pirate King.

events.title: Introduction to Loguetown
events.description: Loguetown is introduced as 'the town of the beginning and the end' - the place where Gold Roger was born and executed, marking the start of the Great Pirate Era. It's described as a significant location that many pirates visit before entering the Grand Line.
events.significance: Loguetown represents a symbolic threshold between the East Blue and the Grand Line. By visiting Roger's execution site, Luffy is following in the footsteps of the Pirate King.

quotes.text: Loguetown - the town of the beginning and the end.
quotes.speaker: Narrator
quotes.context: Introducing Loguetown as the crew approaches

events.title: Gold Roger's Execution Platform Mentioned
events.description: The episode reveals that Loguetown contains the execution platform where Gold Roger was killed, and his final words sparked the Great Pirate Era. This location holds immense significance for all pirates.
events.significance: This reinforces the legendary status of Gold Roger and the historical importance of Loguetown. The execution platform will become a key location in the upcoming arc.

events.title: Crew Domestic Moments
events.description: The episode shows various domestic moments aboard the Going Merry: Usopp accidentally spills experimental chili in Luffy's eyes, Sanji protects Nami's mikan trees from Luffy's hunger, and Nami worries about their expenses.
events.significance: These lighthearted moments showcase the crew's daily life and relationships, providing character development and comic relief before they enter the more dangerous Grand Line.

quotes.text: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Everybody will try to kill us!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Worried about the dangers of having a bounty

quotes.text: Every pirate with a high bounty in East Blue has been defeated by Monkey D. Luffy.
quotes.speaker: Lieutenant Commander Brannew
quotes.context: Explaining Luffy's 30 million berry bounty at Marine HQ

quotes.text: Loguetown - the town of the beginning and the end.
quotes.speaker: Narrator

themes.description: The episode explores how Luffy's first bounty represents official recognition by the World Government. While Luffy sees it as validation of his dream, Nami understands it means increased danger.
themes.symbolism: The wanted poster symbolizes the dual nature of pirate fame - it's both an achievement and a target on one's back.

themes.description: Luffy's decision to visit Loguetown shows his desire to connect with Gold Roger's legacy. By visiting the execution platform, he's symbolically following the path of the Pirate King.
themes.symbolism: Loguetown as 'the town of the beginning and the end' represents both Roger's death and Luffy's new beginning as he enters the Grand Line.

themes.description: The episode shows how Luffy's victories in the East Blue have created ripples across the world. Former enemies form alliances, the Marines take notice, and allies celebrate his progress.
themes.symbolism: The spreading of Luffy's bounty poster represents how one person's actions can affect people across the world.

characterSpotlights.role: Central figure whose bounty drives the episode's narrative
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's pride in his bounty poster reinforces his unwavering optimism and determination to become Pirate King. He sees danger as an adventure rather than a threat.
keyActions: Receives his first bounty poster of 30 million berries
Celebrates his wanted status with pride
Decides to visit Loguetown to see where Gold Roger was executed
quotes: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami's fearful reaction to the bounty shows her more realistic understanding of the pirate world and the dangers they'll face.
quotes: Everybody will try to kill us!

characterSpotlights.development: Shanks' celebration of Luffy's bounty shows his continued faith in the young pirate and pride in his progress toward their shared dream.
keyActions: Receives news of Luffy's bounty from Mihawk
Throws a party to celebrate Luffy's achievement

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on character reactions to Luffy's bounty, showing more scenes with characters like Don Krieg, Koby, and Helmeppo that were not in the manga chapter.
The anime adds domestic comedy scenes aboard the Going Merry, such as Usopp's chili experiment and Luffy trying to eat Nami's mikan trees.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode of the Loguetown Arc, which serves as the final arc of the East Blue Saga.
Luffy's first bounty of 30 million berries was the highest in the East Blue at the time, and unusually high for a rookie pirate.
This episode primarily adapts Chapter 96 of the manga, titled 'Greatest Evil of the East'.
The episode features wanted posters in Fullbody's cabin that include canonical, quasi-canonical, and non-canonical characters from various One Piece media.
Loguetown's name comes from combining elements of 'prologue' and 'epilogue', as it represents both an ending (Roger's execution) and a beginning (the Great Pirate Era).
This episode marks the formation of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance, which will pursue the Straw Hats into future arcs.
